enWisdom: Follow the intelligent one and you will benefit

Wisdom: اتَّهِمُوا عُقُولَكُمْ فَإِنَّهُ مِنَ الثِّقَةِ بِهَا يَكُونُ الْخَطَأُ
enWisdom: Suspect your intellects, for indeed it is from trusting in them that mistakes are made

Wisdom: إِذَا لَوَّحْتَ لِلْعَاقِلِ فَقَدْ أَوْجَعْتَهُ عِتَاباً
enWisdom: When you make an indirect reference to an intelligent person then you have tormented him with reproof
As the intelligent one grows older, his intellect grows younger

Wisdom: تَلْوِيحُ زَلَّةِ الْعَاقِلِ لَهُ مِنْ أَمَضِّ عِتَابِهِ
enWisdom: Hinting at [and making indirect references to] the error of the intelligent person is one of the most agonizing punishments for him

Wisdom: رَسُولُكَ تَرْجُمَانُ عَقْلِكَ وَاحْتِمَالُكَ دَلِيلُ حِلْمِكَ

enWisdom: The lapse of an intelligent person is dangerous
Counter vain desire with the reason

Wisdom: ظَنُّ الْعَاقِلِ أَصَحُّ مِنْ يَقِينِ الْجَاهِلِ
enWisdom: The conjecture of an intelligent person is more correct than the certitude of an ignorant person

Wisdom: ظَنُّ ذَوِي النُّهَى وَالْأَلْبَابِ أَقْرَبُ شَيْ‏ءٍ مِنَ الصَّوَابِ
enWisdom: The conjecture of the people of insight and intelligence is the closest thing to correctness
The punishment of the intelligent is [in the form of] insinuation

Wisdom: لِكُلِّ شَيْ‏ءٍ زَكَاةٌ وَزَكَاةُ الْعَقْلِ احْتِمَالُ الْجُهَّالِ
enWisdom: For everything there is an alms-tax and the alms-tax of intelligence is tolerating the ignorant ones
One who masters his intellect is indeed wise

Wisdom: مَنْ غَلَبَ عَقْلُهُ شَهْوَتَهُ وَحِلْمُهُ غَضَبَهُ كَانَ جَدِيراً بِحُسْنِ السِّيرَةِ
enWisdom: One whose intellect prevails over his lust and his forbearance [overcomes] his anger, then he is worthy of [being deemed as having] good conduct

Wisdom: النَّاسُ مَنْقُوصُونَ مَدْخُولُونَ إِلَّا مَنْ عَصَمَ اللَّهُ سُبْحَانَهُ سَائِلُهُمْ مُتَعَنِّتٌ وَمُجِيبُهُمْ مُتَكَلِّفٌ يَكَادُ أَفْضَلُهُمْ رَأْياً أَنْ يَرُدَّهُ عَنْ فَضْلِ رَأْيِهِ الرِّضَا وَالسَّخَطُ وَيَكَادُ أَصْلَبُهُمْ عُوداً تَنْكَأُهُ اللَّحْظَةُ وَتَسْتَحِيلُهُ [تَسْتَمِيلُهُ‏] الْكَلِمَةُ الْوَاحِدَةُ
enWisdom: People are made deficient and flawed, except those whom Allah, the Glorified, protectsThe questioner among them aims to embarrass and confuse while the answerer creates troubleIt is not long until the one who has the best views among them is turned away from his good opinion by pleasure or displeasure, and at any moment the most strong-willed among them will get affected by a single glance or transformed by a single expression
